private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
My initial location is Richmond District
traveler.goal: Meet Sarah for at least 105 minutes and maximize meeting quality by considering multiple schedules

private_information: I will be at Presidio from 13:15 to 15:15
sarah.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 105 minutes if possible

orchestrator.goal: Integrate individual plans and produce a combined plan that satisfies travel constraints and meeting duration, optimized for meeting the goals

public_information: Travel time from Richmond District to Presidio is 7 minutes
Travel time from Presidio to Richmond District is 7 minutes
You arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
Sarah is available at Presidio from 13:15 to 15:15
Desired minimum meeting duration with Sarah is 105 minutes
Plan should consider various possible schedules and pick the best one
PDDL files should target the FastDownward PDDL solver

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use distinct actions and model temporal constraints where relevant.
pddl.prompt: Your name is traveler. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->traveler->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->traveler->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting FastDownward to represent possible schedules for meeting Sarah. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, provide a plan that concerns only the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use distinct actions and model availability windows where relevant.
pddl.prompt: Your name is sarah. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->sarah->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->sarah->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting FastDownward that encodes your availability and meeting constraints. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, provide a plan that concerns only the information you have. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL for FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and model coordination and temporal constraints explicitly. Integrate partial PDDL inputs and resolve naming or representation ambiguities.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents planning to meet. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. Integrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may require integration to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may include different names for the same location or different temporal encodings. Here is the information the first agent provided: {pddl_traveler} Here is the information the second agent provided: {pddl_sarah} You need to integrate these PDDL responses, keep actions distinct per agent, and produce a combined PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward that considers travel times, arrival time, Sarah availability, and the minimum meeting duration of 105 minutes. Think step by step and provide the combined PDDL domain and problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
